title: Verb patterns: gerund or infinitive - 3
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use the B1gerundB2 or the B1to-infinitiveB2.

sentence: (repair) my car, but as he's only 8 years old, I said no, thanks.
explain: Corr: to repair. After 'offer' we use the to-infinitive.

sentence: (lift) my wife a bit, but she was too heavy.
explain: Corr: to lift. After 'try' we use the to-infinitive if it's an attempt. In suggestions, we can use the gerund.
Corr: to help. After 'promise' we use the to-infinitive.
Corr: to paint or paint. In 'to help sb (to) do sg' both the to-infinitive and the bare infinitive are OK.
_Corr: to come. After 'forget' we use the to-infinitive if express that we didn't do sg because it had slipped out of our mind.
Corr: reading. After 'finish' we use the gerund.
Corr: to get. After 'need' we use the to-infinitive.

sentence: (get) to work in time tomorrow, you’ll risk
explain: Corr: to get. After 'manage' we use the to-infinitive.
Corr: losing. After 'risk' we use the gerund.
